A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Last Jedi is not a Fanboy Service film.  It's a provocative and daring deconstruction of the Star Wars mythology.  There are developments in this movie that some hardcore fans are going to hate.  As a lifelong SW fan who saw \"Star Wars\" in a theater at age 7\, I think Rian Johnson's choices were mostly daring and thoughtful.  I like having my pre-conceived notions challenged and being forced to think about the character arcs.  Here's what I didn't especially like:  the blatant rip-offs of Ron Moore's Battlestar Galactica.  Time to watch \"33\" again.
